children.text: There is excess building debris and/or vegetation in the sub-floor space, which according to the BCA, encourages timber rot, fungus growth and the potential for termite activity.
Part 3.4.1.2 of the National Construction Code’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) states that
‘A subfloor space must be cleared of all building debris and vegetation’ .
Additionally, the Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 18.08 Cleaning, states that
‘Owners are entitled to expect that the building site and works are clean and tidy on completion’ .
The builder will need to remove all building debris and vegetation in the sub-floor space in accordance with part 3.4.1.2 of the BCA.
